Hello Alumni! This is Kortni here, class of 2012. Some of you may have graduated before me, went to school along with me, or know me as Ms. Kortni. Today I come asking for your support. Our class of 2020 will unfortunately not be able to have the same wonderful experience we all had. No prom, no graduation, no walking across the stage. Though this class may not be able to have this experience, we are asking you to help us make it as special as possible. I ask that you record a 30 second video of you giving this class support and well wishes, as they start their new and exciting journey. You can share what you loved about BuffSci and remind them that we are here even after they're gone. We plan to mash them together and display it for all of them to see as they drive up to get their diplomas. It would mean everything to Mr. Sullivan (Senior Grade Chair) and the entire class of 2020. Please send all videos to burg@bascs.org. Thank you and stay safe!

"Buffalo Academy of Science Charter School, nicknamed BuffSci, seems to be pretty good at it. Out of more than 50 schools in the city, only three performed better on the state's English language arts exams for students in grades three through eight – and one of those was another charter school. In math, again only three – including another charter – did better. And BuffSci's 94% graduation rate is something the Buffalo Public Schools can only aspire to, despite recent improvements.

BuffSci is accomplishing all of that with a student body that pretty much mirrors the district's: Its enrollment is 65% African American and 90% low income."

During this time, BuffSci wanted to think of a way we could be helpful not only to our students, but to our community as well! Today we distributed 5,000 hand sanitizers to people in need that are able to share with others! Every single person met today was so grateful for BuffSci’s commitment to our community. They were then able to get our autonomous mode (where the robot does a task without human intervention, coded in milliseconds as opposed to distance) working perfectly. They competed in five matches and finished in 11th place (out of 24 teams), a great improvement over our last tournament.
